country_overview.content: Turkey, straddling Europe and Asia, offers a diverse range of experiences from historical landmarks like the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace to beautiful coastal resorts along the Aegean and Mediterranean seas. Known for its vibrant culture, rich history, and stunning landscapes, Turkey is a favorite destination for travelers. Visa policies for Turkey vary based on nationality, and many visitors require a visa to enter the country.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa allows visitors to stay in Turkey for tourism and leisure purposes. The visa typically allows for stays up to 90 days within a 180-day period.

business_visa.title: Business Visa
business_visa.description: The Business Visa is intended for individuals traveling to Turkey for business purposes such as meetings, conferences, and trade events. This visa also allows stays of up to 90 days within a 180-day period.

student_visa.title: Student Visa
student_visa.description: The Student Visa is for individuals who have been accepted into a Turkish educational institution. The visa is usually valid for the duration of the academic program and may be extended if needed.

work_visa.title: Work Visa
work_visa.description: The Work Visa is required for individuals who have secured employment in Turkey. It allows for long-term residency and is typically tied to the employment contract. A Turkish employer must sponsor this visa.

family_reunion_visa.title: Family Reunion Visa
family_reunion_visa.description: This visa allows family members of Turkish citizens or residents to join them in Turkey. It is usually issued for spouses, minor children, and dependent parents, with the sponsor in Turkey required to demonstrate sufficient income and accommodation.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a valid passport, proof of accommodation, sufficient financial means, and a clear purpose for visiting Turkey. They must also demonstrate the intention to leave Turkey before the visa expires.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of accommodation (hotel bookings, invitation letter, etc.)
Travel insurance covering the duration of stay
additional_documents: Proof of employment or studies in the home country

business_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must provide proof of their business activities in Turkey, such as an invitation letter from a Turkish company or organization, and demonstrate their intent to return to their home country.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Invitation letter from the Turkish company
Proof of business activities (e.g., contracts, correspondence)
additional_documents: Previous business correspondence with the inviting company

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must be accepted into a Turkish educational institution and demonstrate their ability to financially support their stay and studies in Turkey.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Acceptance letter from the educational institution
Proof of financial support (e.g., bank statements)

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on your purpose of travel to Turkey. Ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for the chosen visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for. This may include health checks, financial requirements, and documentation needs.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents, including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Fill Out the Application Form
step_4.description: Complete the visa application form accurately. You can usually find the form on the official website of the Turkish embassy or consulate in your country.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents at the nearest Turkish embassy or consulate. Online submission may also be available in some cases.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: The processing time varies depending on the visa type and your country of residence. Ensure that you provide any additional information if requested by the visa authorities.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified to collect it. Ensure that all the details on the visa are correct before your travel.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees vary depending on the type of visa, the number of entries, and the nationality of the applicant. The fees are non-refundable and must be paid at the time of application. Fees can be paid online or through the embassy/consulate.

processing_time.content: Processing times for Turkish visas generally range from 10 to 20 business days, depending on the type of visa and your country of residence. It is advisable to apply well in advance of your planned travel date.

visa_validity.content: The validity of a Turkish visa depends on the type and number of entries allowed. Tourist and business visas are typically valid for up to 90 days within a 180-day period, while long-stay visas may be valid for several months or years.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in Turkey, travelers must present their valid visa, passport, and sometimes proof of accommodation and sufficient funds. It's essential to adhere to the entry requirements to avoid complications at the border.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Turkey?
faq_1.answer: Yes, certain visas can be extended while you are in Turkey. You need to apply for an extension at the local Immigration Office before your current visa expires.

faq_2.question: Is visa-free entry available for Turkey?
faq_2.answer: Turkey offers visa-free entry for citizens of certain countries. However, most nationalities are required to obtain a visa prior to arrival.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Turkey on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is strictly prohibited. You must apply for a work visa if you intend to work in Turkey legally.
